src:
Kata Penyelenggara IIMS Motobike Soal Honda yang Belum Gabung
05 Nov 2019, 09:37 by Wira Utama, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Market leader sepeda motor Indonesia, Honda dikabarkan absen di pameran IIMS Motobike Expo 2019 di Kawasan Istora Senayan, mulai 30 November sampai 1 Desember 2019.
"Biasa lah masih dibahas di internal. Namanya juga dagang. Tapi kalau misalnya besok pameran dan malam ini, bilang ikut, saya pasti siapkan tempatnya,"ujar Project Director IIMS Motorbike Expo 2019, Hendra Noor Saleh di kawasan SCBD, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Jadi sayang banget kalau Honda belum ikut di pameran pertama motor roda dua ini, kata Hendra. Meski demikian pihaknya masih tetap berupaya menghadirkan sejumlah APM termasuk Suzuki dan merek-merek lokal.
Adapun APM atau merek yang sudah dipastikan ikut hingga hari ini tercatat ada 10, antara lain Yamaha, KTM, Benelli, Vespa, Piaggio, Sinergi, Cleveland, Husqvarna, BMW Motorrad, dan Kawasaki.
Hendra juga menambahkan bahwa pameran kali ini diharapkan bisa meningkatkan penjualan sepeda motor di Indonesia. "Kita berharap pengunjung bisa sampai 50 ribu dengan target transaksi Rp 25 miliar,"ujarnya.
Untuk diketahui jumlah distribusi motor roda dua di Tanah Air yang dihimpun dari data AISI atau Asosiasi Industri Sepeda Motor Indonesia hingga Agustus 2019 menembus angka 4,350,158 unit. Sementara untuk ekspor mencapai 520,279 unit.
text:
The organizer of the IIMS Motobike said about Honda that has not yet joined
05 Nov 2019, 09:37 by Wira Utama, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian motorcycle market leader, Honda, is reportedly absent at the 2019 IIMS Motobike Expo exhibition in the Senayan Istora area, from 30 November to 1 December 2019.
"It's usually still discussed internally. The name is also trade. But if for example the exhibition is tomorrow and tonight, say come along, I will definitely prepare the place," said Project Director of IIMS Motorbike Expo 2019, Hendra Noor Saleh in the SCBD area, South Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
So it's really a shame that Honda hasn't participated in the first exhibition of this two-wheeled motorcycle, said Hendra. Nevertheless it is still trying to bring a number of APMs including Suzuki and local brands.
There are 10 APMs or brands that have been confirmed to have participated, to date, including Yamaha, KTM, Benelli, Vespa, Piaggio, Sinergi, Cleveland, Husqvarna, BMW Motorrad, and Kawasaki.
Hendra also added that the exhibition this time was expected to increase motorcycle sales in Indonesia. "We hope that visitors can reach 50 thousand with a transaction target of Rp 25 billion," he said.
To know the number of two-wheeled motorcycle distribution in the country compiled from AISI data or the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association until August 2019 through 4,350,158 units. While exports reached 520,279 units.
